title: Understanding High-Speed Rail Traction Electromechanical System Fault Detection Technology for [K-12] Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of electrical/mechanical systems and basic data analysis knowledge
context.additional_context: A course focused on cultivating educational design capabilities linked to language fields for pre-service and current teachers

learning_goals: The key components and failure types of high-speed rail traction electrical systems can be explained.
A fault detection data analysis process based on wave packet decomposition and reconstruction can be demonstrated.
The operational principles of a machine learning-based fault diagnosis model through feature vector extraction can be explained.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
